findings.title: buyNFT() Function Does Not Work Correctly
findings.description: The buyNFT() function fails due to incorrect logic where it checks the owner flag after transferring the token using safeTransferFrom(), but the ownedNFT variable is not updated, causing the getOwnedFlag() function to revert.

findings.title: Unproper Amount Adjustment in reSellBuyNFT() Function
findings.description: The reSellBuyNFT() function in NFT_Marketplace.sol adjusts the amount value abnormally, causing only 1 token to be deducted from the seller's ownedNFT variable regardless of the number of ERC1155 tokens purchased.

findings.title: ERC1155#owner is an Inappropriate Variable
findings.description: The ERC1155 contract has a design flaw where one tokenId can have multiple holders, but the owner variable does not account for this. This can cause issues in NFT_Marketplace logic.

findings.title: Insufficient Ether Sent to mintTrade() Function
findings.description: The mintTrade() function can be called with less ether than the specified price, and it will still execute.

findings.title: Fee Logic Error in NFT_Marketplace#buyNFT() and NFT_Marketplace#reSellBuyNFT()
findings.description: The price variable in ownedNFT mapping records the total amount spent, excluding fees, which can lead to abnormal display of prices when purchasing multiple tokens.

findings.title: Royalty Calculation Logic Error in reSellBuyNFT() Function
findings.description: The royalty calculation logic in the reSellBuyNFT() function has an error, causing incorrect royalty and seller cost calculations when there is no fee.

findings.title: Incorrect Price Storage in ownedNFT
findings.description: In NFT_Marketplace#reSellBuyNFT() function, the price value stored in ownedNFT mapping is the total amount spent by the buyer including fees, instead of the intended price per token.

findings.title: Excessive Ether Transfer in mintTrade() Function
findings.description: In NFT_Marketplace#mintTrade(), when currency is 0 (ETH purchase), sending more ether than the price and calling the function will transfer all sent ether to the platform, not just the price amount.

findings.title: burn() Function Can Only Be Called by Creator
findings.description: The burn() function implementation allows only the creator of a token to burn it, instead of the owner.

findings.title: Revert on Currency Value Greater Than 1
findings.description: In functions mint(), mintTrade(), and mintCreator() of NFT_Marketplace contract, it is recommended to revert when currency value is greater than 1.

findings.title: Inconsistent Payment Handling in mintTrade() Function
findings.description: The mintTrade() function allows purchasing with ERC20 token by sending only the price amount to the platform, but when using ETH, it sends the entire value to the platform.
